items.sentence: I usually eat lunch with Tom two or three times a week.
I want to apologize for all the terrible things I said.
I can\'t reach the top shelf unless I stand on a chair.
Does anyone here know what we\'re supposed to be doing?
I think it\'s highly unlikely that Tom will write back.
I thought you thought Tom wasn\'t interested in sports.
Tom told Mary that he didn\'t want her to talk to John.
Tom told me some things about Mary that I didn\'t know.
Tom and Mary don\'t seem to be happy to see each other.
Tom could tell that Mary was expecting him to kiss her.
Tom won\'t be going back to Boston after this, will he?
If you could lend me some money, I\'d be very grateful.
When did you find out that Tom didn\'t want to do that?
You\'ve gotten used to having Tom around, haven\'t you?
Tom knew better than to tell that kind of joke to Mary.
I can\'t help thinking that Tom should be here with us.
I don\'t think any of us are happy about what happened.
I\'m the one who told Tom about what you did yesterday.
I\'ve been debating whether I should mention it or not.
Tom wants to grow a beard, but his wife won\'t let him.
